page.title: 17SPORTS OUTWITH MILTON.
page.content: Each weekend for recreation,I get a bus to the Sports Institute in Glenrothes,7kms west of Milton.I{fence on Friday evenings.Wearing a special jacket,a glove,a wire mask and a plastron (breastplate) for protection, I fight with a long thin sword called a foil.Last month I won a medal. I return to the Sports Institute on Saturdays for{gymnastics.}At present I am practising my one handed cartwheel for the British Amateur Gymnastics Awards.I already have Grades 4,3 and 2.Girls wear leotards,like swimsuits with arms,for gymnastics.The vaulting horse is best.This is a wooden box with a padded top and I do jumps and somersaults over it. After gymnastics I go{swimming.}I swim up and down the pool,training for my 800 metre distance badge.Already I hold my personal survival award.
